Student Meal Distribution

a.title: Click this link for April 20-24 Dinner Subsidy

strong.a: Click this link for April 20-24 Dinner Subsidy

strong.span: NEW! April 16: NYS extends PAUSE to May 15, which includes school closure.

br.span: This page contains updates and proactive measures we are taking as a district related to the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19). In addition, information and guidance provided by the Monroe County and NYS Health Departments, along with the Center for Disease Control are also posted in this section. If you have any questions, please email

strong.span: Reminder: all fields, playgrounds, courts are closed

br.div: It is imperative that we practice social distancing in its entirety. All of our fields, playgrounds, courts and facilities are CLOSED at this time. This includes our main campus, Munn and Taylor. #SpencerportTogether #FlattenTheCurve
We are currently operating at a LEVEL 3. (Cases identified in Monroe County. Still no cases in SpenceprortCSD)

span.strong: For a full list of our levels of response,

br.strong: What is the New York State on PAUSE?

p.style: color: rgb(51, 51, 51); margin-top: 0px; font-family: "Sgy Open Sans", "Lucida Grande", Tahoma, Verdana, Arial, sans-serif;

br.span: – A large family of viruses that are common in people and many different species of animals.
– Abbreviation for the coronavirus disease 2019, a disease caused be a novel (or new) coronavirus that has not previously been seen in humans.
– Measures intended to limit the movement of people in order to interrupt the transmission of infectious, contagious diseases.
• Isolation – Separates sick people with a contagious disease from people who are not sick.
– Separates and restricts the movement of people who were exposed to a contagious disease to see if they become sick.
– When people have been infected with the virus in an area and some are not sure how or where they became infected.
– Affecting or tending to affect a disproportionately large number of individuals within a population, community or region at the same time.
– Occurring over a wide geographic area and affecting an exceptionally high proportion of the population.
- Individuals with at least one respiratory specimen that tested positive for the virus that causes COVID-19 at a state or local laboratory
: U.S. Centers for Disease Control, Merriam-Webster’s Unabridged Dictionary

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: black;

hr.br: Please limit the spread of any respiratory illness, including flu and COVID-19 by:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.span: • Frequently washing hands with soap and using hand sanitizer as needed.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

a.title: Link to CDC on hand washing and its importance

p.a: Link to CDC on hand washing and its importance

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.span:
.)
• Avoiding close contact with people who are sick.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.span: • Avoiding touching your eyes, nose, and mouth.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.span: • Staying home when you are sick.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.span: • Covering your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.span: • Cleaning and disinfecting frequently touched objects and surfaces.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.span: Medical experts consistently share that these simple steps continue to be our best defense.
